Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: There was no change in the levels of DA , norepinephrine ( NE ) , serotonin ( 5 - HT ) , or their metabolites in the arcuate nucleus ( AN ) , medial preoptic area ( MPA ) , caudate putamen ( CP ) , substantia nigra ( SN ) , and zona incerta ( ZI ) , except for a decrease in 5 - hydroxyindoleacetic acid ( 5 - HIAA ) in the AN after 6 - months of hyperprolactinemia and an increase in DA concentrations in the AN after 9 - months of hyperprolactinemia .

Let's think step by step.

1. Hyperprolactinemia: This is the only disease entity mentioned in the paragraph. Hyperprolactinemia refers to a condition characterized by an excess of prolactin in the blood. Prolactin is a hormone produced by the pituitary gland that stimulates breast development and milk production in women. When prolactin levels are too high, it can interfere with menstruation and fertility in women and cause erectile dysfunction and decreased libido in men.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Disease.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: There was no change in the levels of DA , norepinephrine ( NE ) , serotonin ( 5 - HT ) , or their metabolites in the arcuate nucleus ( AN ) , medial preoptic area ( MPA ) , caudate putamen ( CP ) , substantia nigra ( SN ) , and zona incerta ( ZI ) , except for a decrease in 5 - hydroxyindoleacetic acid ( 5 - HIAA ) in the AN after 6 - months of hyperprolactinemia and an increase in DA concentrations in the AN after 9 - months of hyperprolactinemia .

Let's think step by step.

1. DA: This stands for Dopamine, a type of neurotransmitter.
2. norepinephrine ( NE ): Also known as Noradrenaline, it is a hormone and neurotransmitter.
3. serotonin ( 5 - HT ): Also known as 5-Hydroxytryptamine, it is a type of neurotransmitter.
4. 5 - hydroxyindoleacetic acid ( 5 - HIAA ): This is a metabolite of serotonin.
5. 6 - months of hyperprolactinemia: Hyperprolactinemia is a condition of abnormally high levels of prolactin, a hormone produced by the pituitary gland.
6. 9 - months of hyperprolactinemia: Same as above.
7. DA concentrations: Dopamine concentrations.

These are the chemical entities present in the given paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Chemical.

1. Dopamine (DA)
2. norepinephrine ( NE )
3. serotonin ( 5 - HT )
4. 5 - hydroxyindoleacetic acid ( 5 - HIAA )
5. prolactinemia (implied to be a chemical due to its "emia" suffix indicating a blood condition)

These are the chemical entities present in the given paragraph. I have removed the time duration of hyperprolactinemia and the concentrations of dopamine as they are not chemicals themselves, but rather measurements or time-related aspects of the chemicals.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
